oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Johnny Paycheck
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Johnny Paycheck (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Johnny Paycheck; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Johnny Paycheck -- (00:26) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:01) An unidentified host performs a Health Education commercial spot -- (01:40) Someone to Give My Lovin' to (Johnny Paycheck) -- (04:27) Phillips introduces Paycheck to reflect on his move to Nashville, and both discuss Paycheck's George Jones influence -- (07:37) Phillips and Paycheck discuss "My Part of Forever" -- (08:09) My Part of Forever (Johnny Paycheck) -- (10:55) Phillips performs a Project Ahead radio spot -- (11:51) Somebody Loves Me (Johnny Paycheck) -- (14:19) Phillips asks Paycheck to recall "Somebody Loves Me" and the accompanying book; additionally, both reflect on Paycheck's song-writing career -- (18:48) An unidentified host performs an alcoholism commercial spot -- (19:17) Mr. Lovemaker -- (21:28) Phillips asks Paycheck about "Mr. Lovemaker," and Paycheck declares a producer makes the career -- (24:21) Song and Dance Man (Johnny Paycheck) -- (26:45) Phillips performs a Recruiting Command radio spot -- (27:30) Something About You I Love (Johnny Paycheck) -- (29:55) United States Officers commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (31:07) Love is a Good Thing (Johnny Paycheck) -- (33:36) Paycheck reflects on Jerry Foster and Bill Rice's song-writing; additionally, Phillips asks about the commercial aspect of country music -- (40:17) Infectious disease commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (40:48) Paycheck reflects on the Country Music Association Awards -- (44:45) Keep on Lovin' Me (Johnny Paycheck) -- (47:05) Phillips inquires about "Keep on Lovin' Me," and Phillips inquires about the threat of a different type of country music -- (49:05) Voluntary Action commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (49:29) She's All I Got (Johnny Paycheck) -- (52:16) Paycheck reflects on being nominated for a Grammy, and Paycheck and Phillips say goodbye -- (54:20) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Paycheck, Johnny; Phillips, Rick;
